title: Introduction to seededlda
text: use corpus Sputnik articles Ukraine examples. preprocessing, remove grammatical words stopwords("en"), email addresses "*@* words occur 10% documents max_docfreq = 0.1 document-feature matrix (DFM).
code: library(seededlda) #> Warning: package 'quanteda' was built under R version 4.3.3 #> Warning in .recacheSubclasses(def@className, def, env): undefined subclass #> "ndiMatrix" of class "replValueSp"; definition not updated #> Warning: package 'proxyC' was built under R version 4.3.3 library(quanteda)  corp <- readRDS("data_corpus_sputnik2022.rds") toks <- tokens(corp, remove_punct = TRUE, remove_symbols = TRUE,                 remove_numbers = TRUE, remove_url = TRUE) dfmt <- dfm(toks) |>      dfm_remove(stopwords("en")) |>     dfm_remove("*@*") |>     dfm_trim(max_docfreq = 0.1, docfreq_type = "prop") print(dfmt) #> Document-feature matrix of: 8,063 documents, 58,664 features (99.77% sparse) and 4 docvars. #>              features #> docs          reiterated commitment diplomacy worsened reporters urge best #>   s1092644731          1          1         8        1         2    1    1 #>   s1092643478          0          0         0        0         0    0    0 #>   s1092643372          0          0         0        0         0    0    0 #>   s1092643164          0          0         0        0         0    0    0 #>   s1092641413          0          0         6        0         0    0    0 #>   s1092640142          0          0         0        0         0    0    0 #>              features #> docs          forward continuing buildup #>   s1092644731       1          2       2 #>   s1092643478       0          0       0 #>   s1092643372       1          0       0 #>   s1092643164       0          0       0 #>   s1092641413       0          1       0 #>   s1092640142       0          0       0 #> [ reached max_ndoc ... 8,057 more documents, reached max_nfeat ... 58,654 more features ]

title: Introduction to seededlda
text: can fit LDA DFM setting number topics k = 10 identify. verbose = TRUE, shows progress inference iterations. takes long time fit LDA large corpus, distributed algorithm speed analysis dramatically.

title: Introduction to seededlda
text: model fit, can can interpret topics reading salient words topics. terms() shows words frequent topic top matrix.
code: knitr::kable(terms(lda))

title: Introduction to seededlda
text: can also predict topics documents using topics(). recommend extracting document variables DFM fitted object lda$data saving topics data.frame.
code: dat <- docvars(lda$data) dat$topic <- topics(lda) knitr::kable(head(dat[,c("date", "topic", "head")], 10))

title: Benchmaking LDA
text: prepare Sputnik corpus Ukraine way introduction.
code: library(seededlda) library(quanteda) library(topicmodels) library(microbenchmark) library(ggplot2)  corp <- readRDS("data_corpus_sputnik2022.rds") |>     head(1000) toks <- tokens(corp, remove_punct = TRUE, remove_symbols = TRUE,                 remove_numbers = TRUE, remove_url = TRUE) dfmt <- dfm(toks) |>      dfm_remove(stopwords("en")) |>     dfm_remove("*@*") |>     dfm_trim(max_docfreq = 0.1, docfreq_type = "prop") tmmt <- convert(dfmt, to = "tm")

title: Benchmaking LDA
code: microbenchmark(     "topicmodels" = LDA(tmmt, k = 10, method = "Gibbs"),     "seededlda seri" = textmodel_lda(dfmt, k = 10),     "seededlda para" = textmodel_lda(dfmt, k = 10, batch_size = 0.01),     "seededlda auto" = textmodel_lda(dfmt, k = 10, batch_size = 0.01, auto_iter = TRUE),     times = 10 ) |> autoplot(log = FALSE) #> Coordinate system already present. Adding new coordinate system, which will #> replace the existing one.

title: Benchmaking LDA
code: microbenchmark(     "topicmodels" = LDA(tmmt, k = 50, method = "Gibbs"),     "seededlda seri" = textmodel_lda(dfmt, k = 50),     "seededlda para" = textmodel_lda(dfmt, k = 50, batch_size = 0.01),     "seededlda auto" = textmodel_lda(dfmt, k = 50, batch_size = 0.01, auto_iter = TRUE),     times = 10 ) |> autoplot(log = FALSE) #> Coordinate system already present. title: Distributed LDA
text: batch_size = 0.01, distributed algorithm allocates 1% documents corpus processor. uses processors default, can limit number options(seededlda_threads). Despite much shorter execution time, identifies topic terms similar standard LDA.
code: lda_dist <- textmodel_lda(dfmt, k = 10, batch_size = 0.01, verbose = TRUE) #> Fitting LDA with 10 topics #>  ...initializing #>  ...using up to 16 threads for distributed computing #>  ......allocating 81 documents to each thread #>  ...Gibbs sampling in 2000 iterations #>  ......iteration 100 elapsed time: 7.59 seconds (delta: 0.48%) #>  ......iteration 200 elapsed time: 14.32 seconds (delta: 0.02%) #>  ......iteration 300 elapsed time: 20.94 seconds (delta: -0.00%) #>  ......iteration 400 elapsed time: 27.55 seconds (delta: -0.00%) #>  ......iteration 500 elapsed time: 34.13 seconds (delta: -0.01%) #>  ......iteration 600 elapsed time: 40.78 seconds (delta: 0.03%) #>  ......iteration 700 elapsed time: 47.46 seconds (delta: 0.08%) #>  ......iteration 800 elapsed time: 54.06 seconds (delta: -0.10%) #>  ......iteration 900 elapsed time: 61.19 seconds (delta: -0.05%) #>  ......iteration 1000 elapsed time: 69.33 seconds (delta: -0.01%) #>  ......iteration 1100 elapsed time: 77.42 seconds (delta: -0.02%) #>  ......iteration 1200 elapsed time: 85.56 seconds (delta: -0.03%) #>  ......iteration 1300 elapsed time: 93.65 seconds (delta: 0.02%) #>  ......iteration 1400 elapsed time: 101.82 seconds (delta: 0.00%) #>  ......iteration 1500 elapsed time: 110.06 seconds (delta: -0.07%) #>  ......iteration 1600 elapsed time: 118.29 seconds (delta: 0.05%) #>  ......iteration 1700 elapsed time: 126.52 seconds (delta: -0.05%) #>  ......iteration 1800 elapsed time: 134.76 seconds (delta: -0.02%) #>  ......iteration 1900 elapsed time: 143.01 seconds (delta: 0.05%) #>  ......iteration 2000 elapsed time: 151.16 seconds (delta: -0.03%) #>  ...computing theta and phi #>  ...complete knitr::kable(terms(lda_dist))

title: Distributed LDA
text: default, algorithm fits LDA many 2000 iterations reliable results, can minimize number using convergence detection mechanism speed analysis. auto_iter = TRUE, algorithm stop inference convergence (delta < 0) return result.
code: lda_auto <- textmodel_lda(dfmt, k = 10, batch_size = 0.01, auto_iter = TRUE,                           verbose = TRUE) #> Fitting LDA with 10 topics #>  ...initializing #>  ...using up to 16 threads for distributed computing #>  ......allocating 81 documents to each thread #>  ...Gibbs sampling in up to 2000 iterations #>  ......iteration 100 elapsed time: 9.00 seconds (delta: 0.38%) #>  ......iteration 200 elapsed time: 16.98 seconds (delta: 0.09%) #>  ......iteration 300 elapsed time: 25.14 seconds (delta: 0.02%) #>  ......iteration 400 elapsed time: 33.20 seconds (delta: -0.06%) #>  ...computing theta and phi #>  ...complete knitr::kable(terms(lda_auto))

title: Sequential LDA
text: use Sputnik corpus Ukraine, preparation example slightly different introduction. Since Sequential LDA created classification sentences, apply corpus_reshape() corpus segment texts result, DFM documents (150925) sentence number appended document names. sentences make sparsity DFM high (99.98%).
code: library(seededlda) #> Warning: package 'quanteda' was built under R version 4.3.3 #> Warning in .recacheSubclasses(def@className, def, env): undefined subclass #> "ndiMatrix" of class "replValueSp"; definition not updated #> Warning: package 'proxyC' was built under R version 4.3.3 library(quanteda) library(ggmatplot) #> Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.3.3 corp <- readRDS("data_corpus_sputnik2022.rds") |>     corpus_reshape(to = "sentences") toks <- tokens(corp, remove_punct = TRUE, remove_symbols = TRUE,                 remove_numbers = TRUE, remove_url = TRUE) dfmt <- dfm(toks) |>      dfm_remove(stopwords("en")) |>     dfm_remove("*@*") |>     dfm_trim(max_docfreq = 0.1, docfreq_type = "prop") print(dfmt) #> Document-feature matrix of: 150,925 documents, 58,961 features (99.98% sparse) and 4 docvars. #>                features #> docs            monday president joe biden reiterated united states commitment #>   s1092644731.1      1         1   1     1          1      1      1          1 #>   s1092644731.2      0         0   0     1          0      0      0          0 #>   s1092644731.3      0         2   0     1          0      0      0          0 #>   s1092644731.4      0         1   0     0          0      0      0          0 #>   s1092644731.5      0         0   0     0          0      0      0          0 #>   s1092644731.6      0         0   0     0          0      0      0          0 #>                features #> docs            diplomacy tensions #>   s1092644731.1         1        1 #>   s1092644731.2         1        0 #>   s1092644731.3         1        0 #>   s1092644731.4         1        0 #>   s1092644731.5         0        0 #>   s1092644731.6         0        0 #> [ reached max_ndoc ... 150,919 more documents, reached max_nfeat ... 58,951 more features ]

what: Seeded Sequential LDA for Topic Modeling
title: Seeded Sequential LDA for Topic Modeling
text: seededlda R package implements Seeded LDA (Latent Dirichlet Allocation) semi-supervised topic modeling based quanteda. Initially, package simple wrapper around topicmodels package, fully rewritten C++ using GibbsLDA++ library submitted CRAN version 0.5 2020. package developed add sequential classification (Sequential LDA) parallel computing (Distributed LDA) capabilities released version 1.0 2023. keyATM latest addition semi-supervised topic models. users Seeded LDA also encouraged download package.

code: install.packages("seededlda") devtools::install_github("koheiw/seededlda")

title: Optimize the number of topics for LDA — divergence
code: divergence(   x,   min_size = 0.01,   select = NULL,   regularize = TRUE,   newdata = NULL,   ... )

title: Optimize the number of topics for LDA — divergence
text: x LDA model fitted textmodel_seededlda() textmodel_lda(). min_size minimum size topics regularized topic divergence. Ignored regularize = FALSE. select names topics divergence computed. regularize TRUE, returns regularized divergence. newdata provided, theta phi estimated fresh Gibbs sampling. ... additional arguments passed textmodel_lda.

title: Optimize the number of topics for LDA — divergence
text: Returns singple numeric value.

title: Optimize the number of topics for LDA — divergence
text: divergence() computes average Jensen-Shannon divergence pairs topic vectors x$phi. divergence score maximizes chosen number topic k optimal (Deveaud et al., 2014). regularized divergence penalizes topics smaller min_size avoid fragmentation (Watanabe & Baturo, forthcoming).

title: Optimize the number of topics for LDA — divergence
text: Deveaud, Romain et al. (2014). "Accurate Effective Latent Concept Modeling Ad Hoc Information Retrieval". doi:10.3166/DN.17.1.61-84. Document Numérique. Watanabe, Kohei & Baturo, Alexander. (2023). "Seeded Sequential LDA: Semi-supervised Algorithm Topic-specific Analysis Sentences". doi:10.1177/08944393231178605. Social Science Computer Review.

title: Semisupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seededlda
text: Implements semisupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation (Seeded LDA). textmodel_seededlda() allows users specify topics using seed word dictionary. Users can run Seeded Sequential LDA setting gamma > 0.

title: Semisupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seededlda
code: textmodel_seededlda(   x,   dictionary,   levels = 1,   valuetype = c("glob", "regex", "fixed"),   case_insensitive = TRUE,   residual = 0,   weight = 0.01,   max_iter = 2000,   auto_iter = FALSE,   alpha = 0.5,   beta = 0.1,   gamma = 0,   batch_size = 1,   ...,   verbose = quanteda_options("verbose") )

title: Semisupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seededlda
text: x dfm model fit. dictionary quanteda::dictionary() seed words define topics. levels levels entities hierarchical dictionary used seed words. See also quanteda::flatten_dictionary. valuetype see quanteda::valuetype case_insensitive see quanteda::valuetype residual number undefined topics. named "" default, can changed via base::options(seededlda_residual_name). weight determines size pseudo counts given matched seed words. max_iter maximum number iteration Gibbs sampling. auto_iter TRUE, stops Gibbs sampling convergence reaching max_iter. See details. alpha values smooth topic-document distribution. beta values smooth topic-word distribution. gamma parameter determine change topics sentences paragraphs. gamma > 0, Gibbs sampling topics current document affected previous document's topics. batch_size split corpus smaller batches (specified proportion) distributed computing; disabled batch include documents batch_size = 1.0. See details. ... passed quanteda::dfm_trim restrict seed words based term document frequency. useful glob patterns dictionary match many words. verbose logical; TRUE print diagnostic information fitting.

title: Semisupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seededlda
text: textmodel_lda() extra elements dictionary.

title: Semisupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seededlda

title: Sequential Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seqlda
text: Implements Sequential Latent Dirichlet allocation (Sequential LDA). textmodel_seqlda() allows users classify sentences texts. considers topics previous document inferring topics currency document. textmodel_seqlda() shortcut equivalent textmodel_lda(gamma = 0.5). Seeded Sequential LDA textmodel_seededlda(gamma = 0.5).

title: Sequential Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seqlda
code: textmodel_seqlda(   x,   k = 10,   max_iter = 2000,   auto_iter = FALSE,   alpha = 0.5,   beta = 0.1,   batch_size = 1,   model = NULL,   verbose = quanteda_options("verbose") )

title: Sequential Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seqlda
text: x dfm model fit. k number topics. max_iter maximum number iteration Gibbs sampling. auto_iter TRUE, stops Gibbs sampling convergence reaching max_iter. See details. alpha values smooth topic-document distribution. beta values smooth topic-word distribution. batch_size split corpus smaller batches (specified proportion) distributed computing; disabled batch include documents batch_size = 1.0. See details. model fitted LDA model; provided, textmodel_lda() inherits parameters existing model. See details. verbose logical; TRUE print diagnostic information fitting.

title: Sequential Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seqlda
text: textmodel_lda()

title: Extract most likely topics — topics
text: topics() returns likely topics documents based theta parameter.

title: Extract most likely topics — topics
code: topics(x, min_prob = 0, select = NULL)

title: Extract most likely topics — topics
text: x LDA model fitted textmodel_seededlda() textmodel_lda() min_prob ignores topics probability lower value. select returns selected topic highest probability; specify names columns x$theta.

title: Extract most likely topics — topics
text: Returns predicted topics vector.

title: Extract most likely topics — topics
text: Users can access original matrix x$theta likelihood scores; run max.col(x$theta) obtain result topics(x).

title: Changes in v1.3.0
text: Add perplexity() compute perplexity scores fitted LDA models. Improve documentation.

title: Changes in v1.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2024-04-11 Fix tests systems TBB library unavailable.

title: Changes in v1.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-04-10 RcppParallel package longer required TBB library operating system (Linux MacOS) Rtools (Windows) used. Linux MacOS must TBB library enable parallel computing installing package source.

title: Changes in v1.1.1
text: Allow alpha beta vector asymmetric Dirichlet priors.

title: Changes in v1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-07-01 Remove uniform simplify computation seed word weights. Add levels argument better handle hierarchical dictionaries.

title: Changes in v1.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2023-06-12 Fix error textmodel_seqlda() called. Save values Array object double avoid rounding error (#60).

title: Changes in v1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-05-31 Add auto_iter textmodel_seededlda() textmodel_lda() stop Gibbs sampling automatically max_iter reached. Add batch_size textmodel_seededlda() textmodel_lda() enable distributed LDA algorithm parallel computing.

title: Changes in v0.9.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-04-30 Add gamma parameter textmodel_seededlda() textmodel_lda() sequential classification. Add textmodel_seqlda() short cut textmodel_lda(gamma = 0.5). Improve calculation weights seed words. Add regularize argument divergence() regularized topic divergence measure.

title: Changes in v0.8.4
text: CRAN release: 2023-03-23 Fix deprecation Matrix 1.5-4.

title: Changes in v0.8.3
text: CRAN release: 2023-03-17 Add data_corpus_moviereviews package reduce dependency.

title: Changes in v0.8.2
text: CRAN release: 2022-10-09 Add min_prob select topics() greater flexibility Change divergence measure Kullback-Leibler Jensen-Shannon. Add weighted, min_size, select divergence() regularized topic divergence scores.

title: Changes in v0.8.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-03-28 Change textmodel_seededlda() set positive integer values residual. Fix bug textmodel_seededlda() ignores n-grams concatenator “_“. Change topics() return document names. Add divergence() optimize number topics seed words (#26).

title: Changes in v0.8.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-01-07 Add model argument textmodel_lda() replace predict().

title: Changes in v0.7.0
text: Change textmodel_seededlda object save dictionary related settings (#18)

title: Changes in v0.6.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-04-08 Add predict() identify topics unseen documents (#9) Allow selecting seed words based frequencies using dfm_trim() textmodel_seededlda() via ... (#8)

title: Changes in v0.5.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-12-17 Change topics() return factor NA empty documents Fix bug initializing LDA leads incorrect phi (#4 #6)

title: Changes in v0.5
text: CRAN release: 2020-09-10 Implement original LDA estimator using LDAGibbs++ library
